WRITING.TEXT: Well since NASA announced colonising the moon this is true

In CoP i mostly prefer an assault gun (Strelok's SGi) and a sniper rifle to pick of enemies form afar (Lynx is my absolute favourite here) i carry as much anti rads i can, the same applies with medkits, food is optional mostly because every npc has it

WRITING.TITLE: Well this si my stalker story, this is something I've been writing for some time about five months now and i thought I'd share it here
WRITING.TEXT: The ZONE(part1) I never wanted to come to the so-called Zone. I joined the Ukrainian Military just to escape the bad conditions of my poor town, but when a letter came that i was being relocated to the military cordon there my heart sank. I heard so many frightening stories about it, mutants ready to tear you apart every time your guard is down, anomalies where one wrong step means being incinerated, electrified or torn to shreds quite literally. I'm surprised i didn't puke right then and there. I arrived there by jeep, from my first glance i could see that they were throwing away the worst of the worst here. The commander was blackout drunk, most men were shitting their pants, not to lie i did too but at least i knew how to use an AK-74. The worst part was when the night came, i was on guard duty when i saw some older guys force a younger soldier into the dark night to get them vodka. The man was found dead the next morning with his neck broken, poor bastard. If this continues i swear i'll join those damn Loners or whatever they are called. Let's hope i won't be the next poor bastard who's sent to get his superiors drunk.

WRITING.TITLE: Well idk where to post these so I'll just post them here
WRITING.TEXT: Mountain grave "Please god please if you are there please save me" i prayed like there was no tomorrow, until that point i believed in the Russian army, i thought it would be like my grandpa's World War two stories. I thought like it would be like Berlin, that we'd capture the city and be victorious. And yet here is where we were, surrounded, half of our men were either missing or dead, or vehicles were nothing more than burning scrap metal. I prayed behind a destroyed AC, until one of my comrades pulled me away from it "what are you doing Yura are you stupid?! Move your ass we lost enough men already! Move!" It was strange, minutes before it was quiet until we got a warning of the attack, the Chechen commander begged us to leave, but we couldn't, our lieutenant didn't have the authority to do so. We were running out of ammo really quickly. Those damn Chechens, this was their homeland they knew it better than their pockets, this was their little playground and we were the new kids on the block, this was their hell we created. "We have to escape this hell comrades! NOW!" I remember one soldier yelling at us, even though we were exhausted, without ammo, we had one instinct, to survive, we all fought like cornered rats, like animals. We looked at a street, it seemed deserted, i could smell the borscht cooking and the cold night air accompanied it. "Alright, i'll go first, you follow me" said one of my comrades, i don't remember their names, i choose not to, i'd rather not remember anything from that night. He sprinted, he made it about half way there before his head twitched in the left, he was hit by a sniper. I then remembered my grandpa's words, from his time in the Red Army "death isn't scary Yura, it's natural, i met with death many many times during the war, and i was afraid, like a small child i wanted to cry. I wanted my mother's hug, but i became brave, so can you, you are a very very strong and a brave boy." My grandpa was always there for me, he was like a second father to me, when i went to the army he gave me a medal, it wasn't his but it was from the one of the bravest men he served with. It read "The order of the Red banner" and as i knew it belonged to some Boris guy. "Maybe if we run all at once that sniper wouldn't be able to shoot us all" suggested one of us, it was a stupid plan but we still ran like flies without heads. I closed my eyes, i couldn't bare looking at death, i tried to be brave but i couldn't, i only opened my eyes when i rammed my head in a wall. I looked back, out of four or us only two of us remained, the entire night we crawled through the fire. Thankfully we were saved by paratroopers and sent off this hell, i wanted to be friends with that survivor but i learned he killed himself shortly after coming home. I wish my grandpa was here, he'd know how i feel right now.
But they are?
Ahaaa well sorry, i just recently got that advice and this is a older one, and in my country they teach us not to write "I" so i apologise
Thanks for the advice! I'll post more here

WRITING.TITLE: A question
WRITING.TEXT: Okay so I'm writing all sorts of stories but i mostly love to write about WW2 and i was wondering if i could post some here?
Nope i mean a story i personally wrote
Well i could but i though of posting it here
Well i could but i though of posting it here
Well i could but i though of posting it here
Well i try to stay historically accurate but either way they are historically accurate

WRITING.TITLE: Well here's the second part I'll continue posting them here, I'm sorry for my grammar mistakes i hope you enjoy it
WRITING.TEXT: The ZONE (part 2) It wasn't the same in the Zone after the largest emission yet, and it was noticeable. Everyone was different, more angry to put it simply. Our cordon commander Major Khaletskiy got more and more angrier and unstable. He made bad decisions that ultimately costed him his head, the biggest one was underestimating the stalkers and selling them out to the bandits. I also heard that there were even faction wars but i didn't find it important enough. Not to mention that there were new anomalies, just the other day one of our veterans stepped into a anomaly and it tore him to shreds, it still gives me nightmares. The Zone became a different place, a worse place, a more dangerous place, but i didn't know i was about to be thrown right into it. One night, which was surprisingly calm i was stationed at the bases machine gun. I always felt safer when i was on the machine gun, it calmed me down since everything i heard in night were screeches of something, i didn't want to find out what it was. My daydreaming was interrupted by a door being slammed opened, i turned around and there was Major Khaletskiy, drunk as usual, i looked at him in disgust and he looked at me and mumbled something, i ignored him and turned back on my post not thinking much about it. As i was about to go back to my daydreaming i felt something grab my neck tightly as i was thrown at the ground, my heart skipped a beat as i thought a mutant was about to break it. I was dragged for a while before the hand on my neck loosened, i turned on my back as i looked up it was major #8220;bring me vodka you filthy animal, that will teach you not to look at me that way! And don't think of returning without my booze! #8221; He yelled as he proceeded to puke next to me and return to the base. I got up and as i was about to take a step forward Khaletskiy pointed his gun at me, i understood the message, i turned and started to follow the road as in the distance i heard howling. I hope whoever finds this PDA will find my body recognizable enough if i don't survive this night.
Well yes! I am a big fan of the game! The game inspired me to write these kinds of stories
I thank you for the help mate

WRITING.TITLE: I hate myself (original i know)
WRITING.TEXT: Anyway since i knew myself i hate everything about me and when i say everything i mean everything from the way i breathe to the way i walk it seems everything is wrong with me one way or another and it's hard since im always wanting to self-harm, i haven't done it in two weeks but it's harder by the day not to do it again, and the problem is because I'll do it anytime i can and i don't know how to stop, my friend gave me a advice to use a rubber band whenever i want to self harm, but im not sure if it'll work so i wanna know if there are any other methods to stop self harming just for a while until i can fix my mental issues
Thank you very much I'll try some of this

I would of course because money and my scariest dream was literally me in a tunnel coughing blood because i swallowed a blade or something and my throat hurt that morning which made me shit my pants but eh i could live with it
Listening to creepypastas, mostly because the narrators have calming voices, Lazy Masquerade and CreepypastasJr are my personal favourites to listen to

I just think about loli hentai and now every single time i think of that it calms me ignore the fact i didn't watch that in years but anytime i have to go there i just instinctively think of loli hentai and it calms me
A better question is how would she know how her daughters pussy tasted
It was 3am and i was still on my phone not sleeping and my younger brother started insulting me how I'm not doing anything with my life and he just went back to sleep

So basically when i was 12 we didn't have Internet at home for about a month idk why and i can't remember it, anyway i was horny as shit as usual and there was this cafe near our school that had free WiFi and so every lunch break I'd sneak in to the toilets and just do it, i did this for an entire month except for the weekends because i was a anti-social freak
I joined both i didn't know they existed and im sorry i posted here
Hahaha it does thank you very much for the support

WRITING.TITLE: How to stopping self harm
WRITING.TEXT: So I've been hurting myself for a long time a couple of years now and I've been trying hard for these last couple of months to stop that but anytime i last a few months one day everything simply collapses sorta say and i just have to do it and i don't know why, i have this feeling that i deserve that even though i know for a fact that i didn't do anything wrong to anyone but i feel so bad that i have to do something to myself. And i wanted to ask are there any methods to replace it? Like I've heard of pulling a rubber band on my writs but that doesn't really help me
